channel.title: Welcome on Patrick Weygoldt
channel.description: Recent content in Welcome on Patrick Weygoldt

item.title: A collection of data visualizations
item.description: A gallery of recent data visualizations, from simple plots to conference posters and even a video.

item.title: Pretty pictures with angular random walks
item.description: Let’s see how basic random walks can be extended a bit to create interesting visuals.

item.title: How to write coding articles in plain Python files
item.description: How to convert inline a Python file with some inline block comments to a beautiful markdown document

item.title: Chirp detector
item.description: Electric fish produce fast frequency sweeps to communicate, called chirps. Here, I detected these chirps with a CNN-classifier on spectrograms that was trained on data I simulated.

item.title: Labeling images with Label Studio
item.description: Note: This guide was written using label-studio version 1.

item.title: Exploring Electric Fish in the Rainforest of Brazil
item.description: A small report on a field trip to the Amazonian Rainforest in Amapa, Brazil in 2023

item.title: My data science tools in 2023
item.description: A collection of libaries and tools that I use to analyze data with Python

item.title: PlatformIO: Hardware dev from the command line
item.description: An introduction to PlatformIO, a tool that makes software development for microcontrollers easier.

item.title: About
item.description: With knowledge in applied machine learning, software development, and data analysis, I am currently pursuing master’s degrees in Neurobiology and Evolution and Ecology.

item.title: Colorblind direction cells
item.description: Some neurons in thet zebrafish brain respond to movement direction. We recorded and analyzed the activity of these neurons and showed, that these cells probably rely on luminance alone to perceive motion.

item.title: Electric duet
item.description: Some electric fish synchronously modulate their frequencies in duets. I detected these events using a custom covariance-based event detector on frequency estimates from spectrograms.
